comments.comment: If scrolled back to top of the page, the behaviour of the metanav is normally again.

Indeed if
- the compare list menu is showing
- you scroll down so that the sticky header appears
then about 80% of the time the list menu disappears when the mouse moves down. The other menus are fine even with the sticky header.

Not critical for 1.1, can be fixed after go-live

problem is: the flyout is spatially detached from the menu. so when moving the mouse into these gaps non-standard compliant browsers like IE8 have problems detecting/maintaining event targets. as a workaround I suggest we eliminate these gaps for those browsers (flyout docked to menu, no transparent space between flyout and menu, no triangle on top [or keep the triangle but put it on white background]).

It usually works for the other menus except for the list menus. Also it's specific to only one browser and only happens there some of the times. I don't think a profound re-factoring is needed.
Putting this on hold for now, to be re-evaluated after 1.1 go-live.

Issue only in IE8, caused if a link is behind the transparent area. Solved using a transparent GIF image in IE8 as background.

Resolved.
